intro: Helianthopsis pseudoverbesinoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying a rosette of narrow, silvery-gray leaves that reduce water loss. Its yellow flower heads bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy and resilient plant in its native habitat.
